answers.q: how do i set bookmars on sony nwz-e384
answers.a: Isopropyl citrates (E384) are synthetic esters of citric acid used as antioxidants and sequestrants; they chelate trace metals and help keep fats and oils from turning rancid, often enhancing BHA/BHT.

answers.q: how do you change a battery for a sony walkman nwz-e384
answers.a: At permitted food-use levels, E384 is considered safe by regulators (e.g., the EU) and is hydrolyzed to citric acid and isopropanol, which are readily metabolized.
E384 is mainly used in refined vegetable oils, margarines, and other high-fat products to slow rancidity; it is rarely used in beverages or low‑fat foods.

answers.q: how to add folders on my sonywalkman nwz-e384 player
answers.a: It is synthetic and not animal-derived, so it is suitable for vegetarians and vegans, and it is not a common allergen.

answers.q: how to change sony walkman nwz-e384 battery
answers.a: On labels it appears as “E384” or “isopropyl citrates,” with use restricted to certain categories (such as oils and fats) under specific maximum levels.
